Kinematics#

Abstract classes#

Kinematics base class#

class Kinematics#

Abstract Kinematics type.

A kinematics is used to

  • validated twist in the agent’s frame as feasible

  • convert between wheel speeds and body twist

  • store maximal linear and angular speed

  • store the number of degrees of freedom

__init__(max_speed: float, max_angular_speed: float = 0) → None#
feasible(arg0: navground.core.Twist2) → navground.core.Twist2#

Computes the nearest feasible twist to a desired twist.

Parameters:

twist – The desired twist

Returns:

The same desired twist if feasible else the nearest feasible value. How this is defined depends on the concrete sub-class.

get(name: str) → bool | int | float | str | numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64[2, 1]] | List[bool] | List[int] | List[float] | List[str] | List[numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64[2, 1]]]#

Gets the value of the specified property.

Parameters:

name – The name of the property

Raise:

std::runtime_error A runtime error if no property is found.

Returns:

The value of the property

static make_type(name: str) → object#

Create an object of a sub-class selected by name.

Parameters:

type – The associated type name.

Returns:

An object of a registered sub-class or None in case the desired name is not found.

set(name: str, value: bool | int | float | str | numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64[2, 1]] | List[bool] | List[int] | List[float] | List[str] | List[numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64[2, 1]]]) → None#

Set the value of a named property. Fails silently if no property can be found or if the value has a non-compatible type.

Parameters:

  • name – The name of the property

  • value – The desired value for the property

property cmd_frame#
Type:

navground.core.Frame

The most natural frame for this kinematics: Frame.relative() in case the agent is wheeled, else Frame.absolute().

property dof#
Type:

int

The degrees of freedom (between 0 and 3 for planar rigid body kinematics)

property is_wheeled#
Type:

bool

Whether the kinematics has wheels.

property max_angular_speed#
Type:

float

The maximal angular speed.

property max_speed#
Type:

float

The maximal speed.

property properties#
Type:

Dict[str, navground.core.Property]

All properties associated with an owner.

property type#
Type:

str

The name associated to the type of an object.

Wheeled kinematics based class#

class WheeledKinematics#

Bases: Kinematics

Abstract wheeled kinematics

Registered properties:

  • wheel_axis (float, axis)

__init__(*args, **kwargs)#
twist(arg0: List[float]) → navground.core.Twist2#

Convert wheel speeds to a twist

Parameters:

value – The wheel speeds

Returns:

The corresponding twist

wheel_speeds(arg0: navground.core.Twist2) → List[float]#

Convert a twist to wheel speeds

Parameters:

value – The twist

Returns:

The corresponding wheel speeds.

property axis#
Type:

float

The wheel axis.

Omnidirectional#

class OmnidirectionalKinematics#

Bases: Kinematics

Unconstrained kinematics (e.g., quad-copters)

__init__(max_speed: float, max_angular_speed: float) → None#

Constructs a new instance.

Parameters:

  • max_speed – The maximal speed

  • max_angular_speed – The maximal angular speed

Ahead#

class AheadKinematics#

Bases: Kinematics

Kinematics for non-wheeled agents that head towards where they move (e.g., people)

__init__(max_speed: float, max_angular_speed: float) → None#

Constructs a new instance.

Parameters:

  • max_speed – The maximal speed

  • max_angular_speed – The maximal angular speed

Two wheels differential drive#

class TwoWheelsDifferentialDriveKinematics#

Bases: WheeledKinematics

Two differential drive wheels (left, right) (e.g., a wheelchair)

__init__(max_speed: float, axis: float) → None#

Constructs a new instance.

Parameters:

  • max_speed – The maximal wheel speed

  • axis – The wheel axis (i.e., the distance between the wheels)

Four wheels omnidirectional drive#

class FourWheelsOmniDriveKinematics#

Bases: WheeledKinematics

Four Omni-differential wheels (e.g., a Robomaster)

Warning

We assume that the distance between front and back wheel centers is the same as the lateral distance.

__init__(max_speed: float, axis: float) → None#

Constructs a new instance.

Parameters:

  • max_speed – The maximal wheel speed

  • axis – The wheel axis (i.e., the distance between the wheels)
